claim: A claim that the Swedish hospitals were going to start using “death forms” to decide which patients to treat and which to send home to die without healthcare.
label: MISLEADING

claim: Hospitals in Madrid are removing artificial respirators from those admitted with coronaviruses older than 65 years for use by younger patients.
label: False

claim: A video allegedly showing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s wife in a hospital bed urging people to stay home to avoid ending up seriously ill with the novel coronavirus has been shared thousands of times on Facebook and Twitter.
label: False

claim: A list of 10 claims about the coronavirus, allegedly from a doctor who worked in a hospital in Shenzhen.
label: False

claim: There are 1,000 open vacancies for nurses, doctors and other health professionals to work on a temporary hospital in São Paulo, which will be used to treat COVID-19 cases.
label: Partially false

claim: There are 1,000 open vacancies for nurses, doctors and other health professionals to work on a temporary hospital in São Paulo, which will be used to treat COVID-19 cases.
label: Partially false

claim: A lengthy post purportedly contains advice on how to prevent infection from the novel coronavirus. The post claims the advice was issued by a UK hospital to its medical staff.
label: False

claim: Phase 3 means that if Mexico reaches phase 4 all the hospitals that are helping older people are going to let them die to give care to the young.
label: FALSE

claim: Cristiano Ronaldo converts hotels to coronavirus hospitals.
label: FALSE

claim: A video shows healthcare workers dancing in a hospital. The caption says it was filmed in Israel after all COVID-19 patients in the hospital were cured.
label: FALSE

claim: A memo from the St. Luke’s Hospital of Kansas says drinking alcohol lowers the risk of getting infected with COVID-19. Vodka is most recommended for drinking, cleaning and sanitizing.
label: FALSE

claim: Doctors are including “COVID-19 suspect” on death certificates because hospitals receive 18.000 Brazilian reais for each registered COVID-19 death.
label: FALSE

claim: A video shows healthcare workers celebrating in a hospital. The caption says it was filmed in Messejana Hospital, in Fortaleza, Brazil, after all COVID-19 patients were cured and a whole hospital wing was closed.
label: FALSE

claim: A tent will be set up next to the Viamed de Calahorra hospital (La Rioja) to carry out rapid tests for coronavirus.
label: False

claim: Science Minister Pedro Duque was hospitalized due to coronavirus in Denia.
label: False
